Generation VII.Sun: Its body is capable of storing electricity. On camping trips, people are grateful to have one around.
Generation VII.Moon: From the food it digests, it generates electricity, and it stores this energy in its electric sac.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It buries itself in fallen leaves and barely moves, munching away on humus. If you accidentally step on one, you'll get a shock!
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Its stout shell provides excellent defense from attacks. It uses electricity on persistent opponents.

Generation VIII.Sword: While its durable shell protects it from attacks, Charjabug strikes at enemies with jolts of electricity discharged from the tips of its jaws.
Generation VIII.Shield: Its digestive processes convert the leaves it eats into electricity. An electric sac in its belly stores the electricity for later use.

Generation IX.Scarlet: Protected by a sturdy shell, Charjabug eats large quantities of fresh and decomposing leaf litter in order to evolve.
Generation IX.Violet: As it digests fallen leaves, it generates and stores electricity, which it can discharge from the tips of its jaws.

Generation VIII.Sword: Axew's Eye , Dusty Bowl , Hammerlocke Hills Bridge Field , Dappled Grove , Giant's Cap , Motostoke Riverbank , Rolling Fields ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Shield: Axew's Eye , Dusty Bowl , Hammerlocke Hills Bridge Field , Dappled Grove , Giant's Cap , Motostoke Riverbank , Rolling Fields ( Max Raid Battle )

Generation IX.The Hidden Treasure of Area Zero: Fellhorn Gorge , Oni Mountain , Wistful Fields , Paradise Barrens , Kitakami Wilds , Timeless Woods Tera Raid Battles ( 3★ )
